```{r}
# Install packages if you haven't already
# install.packages("ggplot2")
# install.packages("palmerpenguins")

library(ggplot2)
library(palmerpenguins)

# Clean the data (removing NAs for a cleaner plot)
penguins_clean <- na.omit(penguins)

# Create the visualization
ggplot(data = penguins_clean, 
       aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
           y = body_mass_g, 
           color = species, 
           shape = species)) +
  # Add points with transparency to handle overlap
  geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +
  # Add smooth trend lines for each species
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, size = 1.2) +
  # Use a clean, modern theme
  theme_minimal() +
  # Custom colors for a "beautiful" look
  scale_color_manual(values = c("Adelie" = "#FF8C00", 
                                "Chinstrap" = "#9932CC", 
                                "Gentoo" = "#008B8B")) +
  # Labels and Titles
  labs(
    title = "Penguin Size Measurements",
    subtitle = "Relationship between bill length and body mass across three species",
    x = "Bill Length (mm)",
    y = "Body Mass (g)",
    color = "Species",
    shape = "Species",
    caption = "Data: Palmer Station LTER | Table: @allison_horst"
  ) +
  # Refine text and legend position
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 16),
    legend.position = "bottom"
  )
```
